turn.2: A. L. Cronin Aloysius L. Cronin June 30, 1902–September 23, 1974) was an American lawyer and politician.
turn.4: Cronin was born in Chicago, Illinois.
turn.5: Where did he go to school?
turn.6: He went to the Chicago public and private schools.
turn.7: What did he study at school?
turn.8: He received his law degree from Loyola University Chicago School of Law in 1927 and was admitted to the Illinois bar.
turn.9: What did he do after school?
turn.11: Did he ever get into politics?
turn.12: Cronin served in the Illinois House of Representatives from 1949 to 1953 and in the Illinois Senate from 1955 until 1967.
